backend

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • backend.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game class acts as the controller of the game. It has all the state information of the game and implements the main functions that are called by the GUI components. Game has the playerList, the board, the dice, the pool and initial methods.
    Version:
    %I%, %G%
    Author:
    Utku Evci

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(int numPlayer,
            java.util.Scanner in)
        Constructor that creates an instance of a game. It does not only create but also initiates the playerList ant other fields like Dice, Board and Pool
        Parameters:
        in - If in the debug mode the game uses the scanner as the dice input
        numPlayer - number of players that are on the board
        Modifies:
        the playerList. Fills it up with players after initiating

    • Method Detail

      • getSquareNames

        public java.lang.String[] getSquareNames()
        Returns all the square names which are on the board as a string array.
        Returns:
        all the square names which are on the board as a string array.

      • playGame

        public void playGame()
        Updates the view and starts the game by enabling the first player to throw.
        Requires:
        currentPlayer and playerArray are not null

      • throwDiceAndPerform

        public void throwDiceAndPerform()
        Throws the dice and makes the necesearry calls. According to the players situation. If he/she is in the jail than it does a different procedure.
        Requires:
        currentPlayer and playerArray are not null. The player is not bankrupt.

      • movePlayerWithDice

        public void movePlayerWithDice(Player cP)
        Makes the player move just by callin the Player.move2SquareWithDice function.
        Parameters:
        cP - Player to be moved
        Requires:
        dice is thrown appropriately
        Modifies:
        the player and the state

      • finishTurn

        public void finishTurn()
        Finishes the turn of the current player by preparing the game for the next move, which is either Mr. Monopoly Move, double move or pass the dice to the next player
        Requires:
        dice is thrown appropriately
        Modifies:
        the player, dice, game.

      • passTheDice2NextUser

        public void passTheDice2NextUser(Player cP)
        Sets the states of the players appropriately such that next player is able to roll the dice if it is not bankrupt.
        Parameters:
        cP - current player who recently rolled the dice.
        Requires:
        dice is thrown appropriately
        Modifies:
        the players and the state

      • bankruptPlayer

        public void bankruptPlayer(Player giver,
                           Player receiver)
        Bankrupt the player GIVER(1st argument) and gives its belongings and assests to the receiver, which is either another player or NULL, which means the bank.
        Requires:
        giver has to be bankrupt and did not bankrupt earlier.
        Modifies:
        both players and the game in general.

      • getBuyableSq

        public buyableSquare getBuyableSq(java.lang.String ts)
        Gets the square named as ts and casts it into a buyableSquare
        Parameters:
        ts - is a valid square name, if it is not then null is returned
        Returns:
        the square named as the input, otherwise null
        Requires:
        table is initiated.
